title: Phill Davies
text:
Phill Davies, born in <a href="Chester">Chester</a>, is a former England Under 19's & 21's <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who ended his career in 2011 at <a href="Section%20Paloise">Section Paloise</a> a French rugby union club from <a href="Pau%2C%20Pyr%C3%A9n%C3%A9es-Atlantiques">Pau, Pyrénées-Atlantiques</a> currently competing in Rugby <a href="Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a>. Phill Davies also played for <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> and <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a> in the <a href="Guinness%20Premiership">Guinness Premiership</a>, as well as <a href="Aviron%20Bayonnais">Aviron Bayonnais</a> in The French <a href="Top14">Top14</a> competition.
Phill Davies' position of choice was back-row forward/flanker.
Phill Davies started his professional career in 2000 signing at <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> for the 2000-01 <a href="Zurich%20Premiership">Zurich Premiership</a>. During this season <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> won the Parker Pen European Shield competition beating French Top16 team <a href="Narbonne">Narbonne</a> in the final, they also reached the final of the Tetley Bitter League Cup competition coming runners-up to <a href="Newcastle%20Falcons">Newcastle Falcons</a>.
For the 2001-02 Phill Davies signed for fellow <a href="Zurich%20Premiership">Zurich Premiership</a> side <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a> remaining there until January 2005 when he moved on loan to French <a href="Top14">Top14</a> team <a href="Aviron%20Bayonnais">Aviron Bayonnais</a>. During his time at Sale the Sharks won both the 2001-02 & 2004-05 Parker Pen European Shields against <a href="Pontypridd">Pontypridd</a> and <a href="Section%20Paloise">Section Paloise</a>, respectively, as well as finishing 2nd in the <a href="Zurich%20Premiership">Zurich Premiership</a> in 2002. Whilst at the Sharks Davies also represented England Under 21s in both the 5 Nations Championship and the Under 21s World Cup held in Johannesburg, South Africa.
At the start of the 2005–06 season Davies made his loan move to <a href="Aviron%20Bayonnais">Aviron Bayonnais</a> permanent and remained at the club for a further 2 seasons, signing in 2007 for <a href="Guinness%20Premiership">Guinness Premiership</a> side <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a>. During his time at <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a> the club finished 2nd in the 2008-09 <a href="Guinness%20Premiership">Guinness Premiership</a> as well as reaching the semi-finals of the <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a>. In 2009-10 Phill Davies signed for <a href="Section%20Paloise">Section Paloise</a> (Pau) in the French <a href="Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a>, before retiring professionally at the start of 2011.
